intro: Heeria fulva, commonly known as the red-stemmed heeria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that turn red when mature. Heeria fulva is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
